author: EP
title: Los bomberos rescatan a unas 90 personas atrapadas en una noria de San Sebastián por una avería
text:
Bomberos de
[San Sebastián](/tags/san-sebastian/) están rescatando a usuarios de la noria ubicada en el Alderdi Eder de la capital guipuzcoana, después de que la instalación sufriera una avería sobre las 19.00 horas de este jueves, dejando suspendidas en el aire a unas 90 personas que ocupaban las 24 cabinas de la atracción.
Según han informado fuentes municipales, el incidente ha ocurrido sobre las siete de la tarde, en hora punta de la noria de 32 metros de altura, que tenía ocupadas todas sus cabinas. Los responsables de la misma han intentado arreglar la avería durante una hora, sin éxito.
Transcurrido ese tiempo han avisado a los bomberos, quienes tras comprobar que tampoco se podía reanudar la marcha de la instalación, han decidido ir rescatando poco a poco, mediante dos escalas, a todos los usuarios atrapados.
Sobre las 21.00 horas, los bomberos habían rescatado ya a personal que ocupaba diez cabinas de las 24, y seguían desalojando a más clientes, que se encuentran "tranquilos", sin que se hayan producido daños personales.

author: Meghan Moriarty
title: ‘We look out for ourselves:’ Jacksonville apartment complex deemed ‘public nuisance’ – Action News Jax
text: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. — A Westside apartment complex has to ramp up security or it could risk being shut down. >>> STREAM ACTION NEWS JAX LIVE The City of Jacksonville’s Public Nuisance Abatement Board (PNAB) deemed Valencia Way Apartments a ‘public nuisance,’ on Thursday. It cited 11 qualifying factors of violent incidents, not including the murder at the complex that happened last week. DOWNLOAD: [Free Action News Jax app for alerts as news breaks ] Chief Morris Halyard III with JSO said the property currently has one security guard on the property and most of the cameras are inoperable. “We look out for ourselves,” Destiny said. She had family who lives at Valencia Way and visits often. “I don’t feel safe going outside with them [the kids]. It’s too much shooting, kids fighting, all that stuff.” During the Thursday afternoon meeting, the PNAB took jurisdiction of the complex. According to property records, Millennia Jacksonville owns the property. The owner was not present, but his attorney, Christopher Walker, agreed to most of the stipulations by the PNAB and the Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office. Those changes include more security cameras and at least three JSO officers and a supervisor on the property for the next 60 days twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week. Walker said the owner of the complex cannot afford the manpower. Representatives for the sheriff’s office and the city plan to work with the owner to figure out a cost-effective way to make it all happen. Council member, Tyrona Clark-Murry, who represents District 9 where the complex is located, said those issues should be worked out in the next two weeks. A Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design (CPTED) will also be completed in the next few weeks to determine the exact changes that need to be made to the property. This intense takeover comes after crime has plagued the property for years. Recently, there have been three murders in three months. In October of last year, a teenager was killed at the apartment complex. Just five days later, a 36-year-old man was found dead at the complex. And, just last week, 27-year-old Nathaniel Barnard was also killed outside the complex. No arrests have been made in any of those cases. There have been 43 incidents within a half mile of the property in the last four months, according to the Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office crime mapping tool. We filtered it to only show the most violent crimes. The breakdown showed two homicides (not including the most recent murder), 15 burglaries, and 26 assaults in the last 123 days. SIGN UP: [Action News Jax Daily Headlines Newsletter ] The next meeting for the PNAB is Feb. 15 at City Hall. Click here to download the free Action News Jax news and weather apps, click here to download the Action News Jax Now app for your smart TV and https://www.actionnewsjax.com/video/ to stream Action News Jax live.

author: GetFeatured
title: Off The Grid: Revolutionizing Solar Power and Home Improvement in Australia | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Off The Grid, a leading provider of solar panel installation, maintenance, off-grid solar repairs, hybrid solar systems, and comprehensive home improvement services, is proud to announce its continued commitment to powering Australian homes sustainably while enhancing living spaces. With over 20 years of combined experience, Off The Grid stands at the forefront of the industry, offering unparalleled expertise and dedication to environmental stewardship.
Headquartered in Brisbane and Melbourne, Off The Grid is not just another solar installation provider, but it also plans to extend services to New South Wales. The company is a trusted partner in transforming homes into eco-friendly havens, offering a seamless, one-stop-shop experience through its sister company, Renovation Saver. This unique combination of solar technology and home improvement services ensures that clients receive top-notch products and services designed to endure the test of time.
Innovative Solar Solutions
Off The Grid specializes in the installation of high-efficiency solar panels, catering to both residential and commercial clients. The company’s solar solutions include grid-tied, off-grid, and hybrid solar systems, all designed to meet the diverse energy needs of Australians. With a focus on sustainability, Off The Grid collaborates with premier Australian manufacturers and suppliers to provide durable and reliable solar products.
Comprehensive Maintenance and Repair Services
Recognizing the importance of maintaining optimal performance, Off The Grid offers comprehensive maintenance and repair services for solar systems. This includes routine inspections, cleaning, and troubleshooting to ensure maximum efficiency and longevity. The company’s team of skilled technicians is adept at handling off-grid solar repairs, ensuring that clients in remote areas remain powered and self-sufficient.
Hybrid Solar Systems: The Future of Energy
Off The Grid is at the cutting edge of hybrid solar technology, integrating solar power with traditional energy sources to provide reliable and efficient power solutions. These systems are designed to reduce dependency on the grid while ensuring a consistent power supply, even during peak usage times or in adverse weather conditions. Hybrid systems offer the perfect balance between sustainability and reliability, making them an ideal choice for modern Australian homes and businesses.
Enhancing Living Spaces with Renovation Saver
In addition to solar solutions, Off The Grid offers a range of home improvement services through Renovation Saver. This includes air conditioning service, hot water unit installations, and other essential home upgrades. By combining solar technology with home improvement expertise, Off The Grid provides clients with a holistic approach to enhancing their living spaces. Each project is tailored to meet the specific needs and preferences of clients, ensuring optimal comfort and efficiency.
Commitment to Excellence and Sustainability
Off The Grid’s commitment to excellence drives the company to collaborate with top-notch Australian manufacturers and suppliers. This partnership ensures that clients receive products that are built to last, backed by robust warranties and superior performance. The company’s dedication to sustainability extends beyond product offerings; it encompasses every aspect of its operations, from eco-friendly practices in installation and maintenance to ongoing education and support for clients.
Creating a Greener Future Together
Off The Grid believes in the power of collaboration to create a greener and more sustainable future. By partnering with clients, manufacturers, and the broader community, the company is making significant strides toward reducing carbon footprints and promoting renewable energy. Off The Grid’s vision is to empower Australians to make environmentally conscious choices that benefit both their homes and the planet. For More Information Visit https://offthegridenergy.com.au/
About Off The Grid
Off The Grid is a leading solar and home improvement company with over 20 years of combined experience. Based in Brisbane and Melbourne, with plans to expand to New South Wales, the company is committed to providing sustainable energy solutions and enhancing living spaces through high-quality products and services. Off The Grid partners with top Australian manufacturers and suppliers to ensure the durability and reliability of its offerings, creating eco-friendly homes and businesses across Australia.

author: Carmen Torres González
title: Prevén ambiente extremadamente caluroso para la Península de Yucatán - Noticias de Yucatán
text:
MÉRIDA, Yuc., 22 de marzo de 2024.- Este viernes, el frente frío No. 41 afectará el noreste y oriente del país e interaccionará con canales de baja presión que se extenderán sobre el suroeste del Golfo de México y la Península de Yucatán; dichos sistemas producirán lluvias con intervalos de chubascos en las regiones mencionadas, además de lluvias puntuales fuertes, descargas eléctricas y posible caída de granizo en zonas de Puebla, Veracruz, Campeche, Yucatán y Quintana Roo. Asimismo, se prevé viento de componente norte con rachas de 40 a 60 km/h en el litoral de Tamaulipas, Veracruz, Tabasco y Campeche, esto según el reporte diario del Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN).
En la Península de Yucatán se prevé cielo medio nublado a nublado con lluvias puntuales fuertes, descargas eléctricas y posible caída de granizo en Campeche, Yucatán y Quintana Roo, las cuales podrían originar encharcamientos e inundaciones. Ambiente templado por la mañana y extremadamente caluroso durante la tarde. Viento de componente norte con rachas de 40 a 60 km/h en Campeche y de igual intensidad, pero de dirección variable en Yucatán y Quintana Roo.
Por su parte, el meteorólogo Juan Antonio Palma de Meteorología Yucatán indica que este viernes se percibirá ambiente extremadamente caluroso en la mayor parte de la región. Durante la tarde y noche se esperan tormentas dispersas en algunas zonas. No se descarta actividad eléctrica, turbonadas y caída de granizo.
Las temperaturas máximas podrían alcanzar entre 40 °C y 42 °C con sensaciones térmicas de cerca de 50 °C en Yucatán y Campeche.

author: Lisa Respers France, CNN
title: Jennifer Garner’s golden retriever ‘got a promotion’ to therapy dog
text:
(CNN) — Jennifer Garner’s golden retriever has some goals before she turns nine, though she has already achieved one.
During
an appearance on the WeRateDogs Youtube channel, Garner walked her dog, Birdie, and spoke about her beloved companion.
(CNN) — Jennifer Garner’s golden retriever has some goals before she turns nine, though she has already achieved one.
During
an appearance on the WeRateDogs Youtube channel, Garner walked her dog, Birdie, and spoke about her beloved companion.
It was noted that
Garner did 50 things to celebrate turning 50 and was asked if Birdie had nine things she wanted to accomplish before she turns that age.
According to the actress, who asked Birdie and then spoke for her, the pooch would like to go to Paris, eat an entire string cheese, skydive and go on a date with President Biden’s dog, Major, whom she has “a big crush” on.
Birdie would also like to read some new books with kids.
“Speaking of kids, Birdie’s a therapy dog and she just got a promotion to work at Children’s Hospital LA,” Garner said. “She’s excited.”
Oh, and Birdie is a soprano who would like to sing with the Metropolitan Opera and she’d also like to stop biting her nails.
Garner’s social media followers are familiar with Biride due to her series “Books with Birdie,” which she shares online.

author: Dirección de Comunicaciones
title: UIS lidera la transición hacia la sostenibilidad con el 1er Seminario Internacional en Soluciones Basadas en la Naturaleza y Bioeconomía Circular
text:
La Universidad Industrial de Santander (UIS), a través de su Escuela de Biología, inició hoy jueves 3 y hasta mañana viernes 4 de octubre de 2024, el Primer Seminario Internacional en Soluciones Basadas en la Naturaleza y Bioeconomía Circular (BIOEC). Este importante evento reafirma el compromiso de la UIS con la investigación y el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras para enfrentar los desafíos ambientales actuales, como el cambio climático, la escasez de agua y la degradación de ecosistemas.
Coordinado por el director Centro de Biotecnología & Agroindustria-ABC de la Facultad de Ciencias, el profesor Nelson Rodríguez López, el seminario reúne en jornadas académicas a expertos e investigadores nacionales e internacionales en el campo de la sostenibilidad, con el objetivo de fortalecer redes de colaboración en torno a las Soluciones Basadas en la Naturaleza (SbN) y la bioeconomía circular en Colombia. Estas soluciones, que aprovechan los procesos naturales para mejorar la resiliencia de los ecosistemas, ofrecen una oportunidad única para restaurar hábitats, gestionar recursos hídricos y combatir la deforestación, mientras se reducen los gases de efecto invernadero y se promueve la seguridad alimentaria.
La bioeconomía circular, pilar del seminario, busca optimizar el uso de recursos biológicos, minimizando la generación de residuos y potenciando la autosuficiencia alimentaria mediante prácticas como la agricultura regenerativa. La UIS se posiciona como un referente en el estudio y la implementación de estas estrategias, con el objetivo de aportar soluciones locales que puedan tener un impacto global.
Sebastián Rueda Serrano, estudiante de sexto semestre de Biología en la UIS, destaca la relevancia académica del seminario, describiéndolo como una oportunidad invaluable para el crecimiento académico. “El seminario es una experiencia enriquecedora, ya que integra diferentes disciplinas como la Microbiología, la Biología Molecular, la Agronomía y otras áreas relacionadas con el medio ambiente”, señaló Rueda. Además, destacó la importancia de que la Universidad Industrial de Santander tome la iniciativa de organizar este tipo de espacios, que no solo permiten a los estudiantes ampliar sus conocimientos, sino también interactuar con expertos nacionales e internacionales en un tema tan crucial y vigente como es el impacto ambiental y las estrategias para su recuperación.
De otra parte, David Johnson Monje, de nacionalidad canadiense y estudiante de la Universidad del Valle, resalta la importancia de la colaboración internacional en esta clase de eventos académicos. “Es gratificante contar con la presencia de personas de distintos países y áreas de investigación, compartiendo en un evento que reúne a grandes expertos en diversas temáticas”. Asimismo, subrayó que estos espacios son fundamentales para facilitar nuevas colaboraciones. “Es crucial crear estos encuentros donde científicos y estudiantes puedan relacionarse, conocer sus potenciales, compartir ideas y visualizar nuevos proyectos. Lo más valioso es que se genera un ambiente de aprendizaje continuo, ampliando el conocimiento. Nunca debemos dejar de aprender”
Este Seminario Internacional en Soluciones Basadas en la Naturaleza y Bioeconomía Circular (BIOEC) refuerza el liderazgo de la UIS en la creación de iniciativas que promueven la sostenibilidad y la protección de los ecosistemas, reafirmando su papel como impulsora de cambios significativos para un futuro más consciente y ambientalmente responsable.
